PERSONA:
john michael wilson, a 57-year-old white non-hispanic male, was born and raised in fort collins, colorado, a metropolitan area within the mountain division of the west census region. he is a lifelong resident of the united states and has a strong protestant upbringing. john holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from colorado state university, followed by some postgraduate coursework in finance from the university of colorado boulder. he has been married to his wife, emily, a school teacher, for 29 years, and they have two grown children who are both attending college out of state.

john currently works as a financial analyst at a mid-sized manufacturing firm in the private sector, earning a salary of $65,000 per year. before this role, he worked as an accountant for a small business for 10 years. john has been a registered republican voter since he turned 21 and identifies as a conservative, with a deep-rooted belief in fiscal responsibility and limited government intervention in economic matters. he seldom attends church services but maintains a strong faith and values the teachings of his protestant upbringing.

john and his wife own a single-family home in a suburban neighborhood in fort collins, which they purchased 15 years ago. the home is valued at $450,000, and they have an outstanding mortgage balance of $120,000. john's family income, including his wife's salary, is around $62,000 per year. despite being a middle-income household, john is concerned about the increasing national debt and wants the government to focus on reducing spending rather than increasing taxes.

john is an avid internet user, accessing it several times a day for news, work, and staying in touch with his children. he is not engaged in any volunteer work and prioritizes spending time with his family. although he values the importance of community involvement, his current priorities focus on financially supporting his children's education and paying off his mortgage. he plans on retiring in about 8 years and hopes to travel with his wife and pursue his passion for woodworking.

as a conservative republican, john's economic concerns revolve around fiscal responsibility and what he perceives as government overreach. he supports policies that reduce government spending and lower taxes, believing they will stimulate economic growth. john closely follows politics but has become increasingly frustrated with the partisan gridlock and wishes politicians would focus on solving real problems rather than engaging in what he views as partisan games.
